overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). The analyst identifies daily seasonality, evaluates multiple methods (SARIMA, exponential smoothing, naive approaches), and selects a simple averaging technique due to data constraints. The solution prioritizes robustness over complexity, focusing on pattern extraction while acknowledging limitations like insufficient weekly seasonality data.
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) restricts complex modeling and weekly seasonality capture
Daily patterns dominate and can be extracted via hourly averaging
Day-of-week effects are acknowledged but unaddressed due to insufficient historical data
Profile-based forecasting is preferred over trend projection when seasonality is strong
Data completeness verification precedes modeling decisions
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines data inspection, multi-method evaluation, and practical simplifications tailored to data limitations, but avoids advanced statistical modeling due to sample size constraints.
